intro: Triguera ambrosiaca, commonly known as wormseed, is an annual herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces tiny, oval-shaped seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are hairy and have a strong, distinctive odor. Triguera ambrosiaca is also known for its association with the Mexican tradition of the Day of the Dead.
